According to the current state, my avatar (represented as '*') is at position (1, 1) and does not have the key (nokey). The nearest key is located at (9, 11) represented as '%'. To reach the key while avoiding hazards like holes ('$') and mushrooms ('&'), I need to navigate through the level carefully.

Looking at the layout, I can move right to (1, 2) and (1, 3) where there are safe floor tiles ('.'), allowing me to progress towards the key while observing for hazards.

I will choose the action to move right from my current position. 

``` Action: 2 ```
This action should allow me to advance toward the key without encountering any immediate hazards. I expect to see that my avatar's position changes after executing this action.

The current situation shows me the possible safe paths. From (1, 2), I can again move right to (1, 3) where the floor is safe, allowing continuous progress toward the key without encountering immediate hazards.

I will take the action to move right again. 

``` Action: 2 ```
This action should ensure I'm progressing toward the key while maintaining safety, and I expect to see my avatar move to position (1, 3).

=== Action History ===
right,right

After executing the second action to move right, my avatar has moved to position (1, 3). Now I can see that I have more options for movement as I continue towards my target, which is the key located at (9, 11).

From position (1, 3), the next possible action is to move right to (1, 4), which is also a safe floor tile ('.'). This movement keeps me aligned with my objective of reaching the key while ensuring I avoid hazards.

I will take the action to move right once again.

``` Action: 2 ```
This action will move me closer to the goal of obtaining the key, and I expect to see my avatar positioned at (1, 4) after executing this action.
